conclusion: Device consists of a container C with a U-tube B connected to it, arms A and D, arm D filled with liquid.
Initial state: solid not in container C, liquid levels in arms A and D are equal.
Placing solid in container C displaces air, creating pressure difference, causing liquid in U-tube to move.
Observe new liquid levels in U-tube after placing solid in container C.
Difference in liquid levels (Δh = h2 - h1) indicates volume of air displaced by solid.
Volume displacement principle: volume of air displaced by solid equals volume of solid.
Cross-sectional area of U-tube is A_tube.
Volume of solid V_solid can be calculated using formula V_solid = A_tube × Δh.
By measuring Δh and knowing A_tube, volume of solid can be determined.
Final answer: volume of measured solid is V_solid = A_tube × (h2 - h1).
